titleStmt.title: Crambo,
On Molly Mog, at the Rose-Inn

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Says my Uncle, I pray you discover What has been the Cause of your Woes,
That you pine, and you whine, like a Lover?I've seen Molly Mog of the Rose.2.
Oh Nephew! your Grief is but Folly, In Town you may find better Prog;
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly,A Molly much better than Mog.3.
The School boys delight in a Play-Day, The School Master's Joy is to Flog;
Fop is the delight of a Lady,But mine is in sweet Molly Mog.4.
Will-a-Wisp leads the Traveller a gadding, Thro' Ditch, and thro' Quagmire and Bog;
No Light can e'er set me a padding,But the Eyes of my sweet Molly Mog.5.
For Guineas in other Mens Breeches Your Gamesters will palm and will cog;
But I envy them none of their Riches,So I palm my sweet Molly Mog.6.
The Hart, that's half-wounded, is raging, It here and there leaps like a Frog;
But my Heart can never be changing,It's so fix'd on my sweet Molly Mog.7.
I know that by Wits 'tis recited, That Women at best are a clog;
But I'm not so easily frighted,From loving my sweet Molly Mog.8.
A Letter, when I am inditing, Comes Cupid and gives me a Jog;
And I fill all my Paper with writing,Of nothing, but sweet Molly Mog.9.
I feel I'm in Love to Distraction, My Senses are lost in a Fog,
And in nothing can find Satisfaction,But in Thoughts of my sweet Molly Mog.10.
If I would not give up the three Graces, I wish I were hang'd like a Dog;
And at Court all the Drawing-Room Faces,For a Glance at my sweet Molly Mog.11.
For those Faces want Nature and Spirit, And seem as cut out of a Log;Juno, Venus, and Pallas's Merit,Unite in my sweet Molly Mog.12.
Were Virgil alive with his Phillis,And writing another Eclogue;
Both his Phillis and fair Amarillis,He'd give for my sweet Molly Mog.13.
When Molly comes up with the Liquor, Then Jealousy sets me a Gog;
To be sure She's a Bit for the Vicar,And so I shall lose Molly Mog.Y29-321L
